info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 8:44PM EDT until July 21 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
FFWRNK
The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Smyth County in southwestern Virginia...
* Until 245 AM EDT Monday.
* At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Sugar Grove... Broadford... Adwolf... Thomas Bridge...
This includes the following streams and drainages... Deans Branch, Dickey Creek, Locust Cove Creek, Laurel Creek, Comers Creek, Little Tumbling Creek, Little River, Hungry Mother Creek, Middle Fork Holston River, Laurel Springs Creek, Beaver Creek, Marchant Creek, Crewey Branch, Campbell Creek, East Fork Hopkins Branch and Georges Branch.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
